Package com.example

Class Menu

java.lang.Object
com.example.Menu
public class Menu extends Object
This class is used to show user a menu in a CLI interface.
Author:
Daniel Gonzalez

    • showInitialMenu

      public int showInitialMenu()
      Method to show initial menu of register, login and exit.
      Returns:
      it returns the option selected of the initial menu.

    • askCredentials

      Method for asking credentials when login.
      Returns:
      a list with username and password

    • showActionsMenu

      public int showActionsMenu()
      Method to chat actions.
      Returns:
      number of option chosen.

    • showRoster

      public void showRoster(String roster)
      Method to print the roster of the user.
      Parameters:
      roster - the list of the contacts.

    • getStatusMessage

      public String[] getStatusMessage()
      Method to get the new status type, mode and message.
      Returns:
      array of 3 elements with the options selected.

      public String getUserToChat()
      Method to get the user to chat.
      Returns:
      the user specified to chat

      Method to get the user and file to send.
      Returns:
      a list of 2 elements containing the user and the file to send.

      Method to get the user to subscribe from terminal

    • groupChat

      public int groupChat()
      Method to get the option of the action in groupchat.
      Returns:
      the number of option chosen.

    • inviteToGroupChat

      public ArrayList<String> inviteToGroupChat()
      Method to select a group and a user to invite to.
      Returns:
      a list of 2 elements containing the group name and the user.

    • getGroupNameToChat

      public String getGroupNameToChat()
      Method to get the groupname where user wants to chat.
      Returns:
      a string containing the groupname.

    • getGroupChatInfoCreation

      public ArrayList<String> getGroupChatInfoCreation(int option)
      Method to get the information about the creation of groupchat.
      Parameters:
      option - it indicates whether we are creating a group or joining a group. Its values are 1 or anything else.
      Returns:
      a list of 2 elements with the new group name and the alias the user wants to have.
